features: ONLY CRIB RAIL THAT FIRMLY ANCHORS TO BED FRAME WITH REINFORCED CLAMPS for 100% safety. Cannot slip out of place like other crib rails.

UNMATCHED QUALITY - Heavy-duty, rigid frame throughout, and reinforced nylon fabric safely holds your baby in the crib. Plus, it will never fray or tear. Design, safety, quality and unsurpassed customer service...that's hiccapop!
FOLDS DOWN FOR BEDTIME STORIES - Makes transition from crib to toddler bed fun and STRESS-FREE!

ASSEMBLES IN MINUTES - Our convertible crib bed railing is designed for simple, intuitive, stress-free installation. No tools needed. Includes easy-to-follow instructions. FITS ALL MAJOR BRANDS OF CRIBS (except IKEA).
PASSES ALL FEDERAL SAFETY REGULATIONS. LEAD-FREE PAINT AND NO PHTHALATES

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Our convertible bed rail is the safest and sturdiest system on the market today. Thoughtfully designed and engineered to provide parents peace of mind and 100% safety for their little ones while they sleep. Our reinforced steel anchor system attaches directly to the crib to ensure the rail will NEVER shift. It fits all standard cribs (except IKEA) and is easy to install requiring no tools. Each rail is made with the highest quality metal, nylon-plastic and heavy duty fabrics available, so your children can use it for a LIFETIME.

Easy Access Fold Down Rail Childproof heavy duty hinges fold down fully out of the way for daytime use, bedtime stories and easier sheet changes. Secure Safety Latching Passive safety latches allow the rail to pop upright into place and lock securely to keep even the most active children from falling out. Stress-Free Installation Designed for simple, intuitive assembly with no tools needed. And with easy-to-follow instructions – you’re up and running in minutes! Unmatched Quality Made of ultra durable child-safe fabric that will never fray or tear and, each cover removes for convenient machine washing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best bed rail!
reviews.reviewText: The hiccapop Convertible Crib Bed Rail has been a game-changer in transitioning our toddler to a big-kid bed. The reinforced anchor safety feature provides us with peace of mind, ensuring a secure and stable attachment to the crib. The convertible design adds versatility, allowing for a seamless transition as our little one grows. Installation was surprisingly straightforward, and the rail's sturdy construction gives our toddler the independence to get in and out of bed safely. hiccapop has crafted a reliable and practical solution for parents navigating the toddler bed phase, making bedtime routines smoother and safer for both parents and little ones alike.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect transition for young toddlers!
reviews.reviewText: My daughter suddenly attempted getting out of her crib at 20 months old (and was successful). Her crib is not a standard convertible crib-to-toddler bed so I resorted at first to putting her mattress on the floor, but after many sleepless nights realized she was rolling off the mattress and while it wasn’t a hard fall, it was enough to wake her.ONE DAY after ordering this in desperation to create a safe type boundary in her crib again, it arrived and saved my sanity!It was VERY simple and straightforward to put together, which was amazing because I usually leave assembling things to my husband, but I was completely capable doing it by myself.Sturdy and secure and no problem with the fit to my hand-me-down crib that was made 20 years ago.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Saved us money!
reviews.reviewText: My 2 year old has a convertible crib but kept sliding out of the bed in the middle of the night. This was super easy to install, is good quality and has solved our issue completely. It’s also really nice how the rail collapses because that helps me out when I have to make the bed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice option for toddler bed conversion, but it shows signs of wear over time
reviews.reviewText: This was a good option to convert our crib into a toddler bed. The installation is relatively easy, but probably takes 10-15 minutes to get everything put together. The sturdiness is pretty good and would have no issue keeping a kid from falling out of bed, but it's not rock-solid. If the kids were leaning on it sitting up it would rock back and forth. Not a huge issue, but it's definitely not as solid as the other wooden rail that we got for my other daughters crib conversionIt looked great at first but after a few months of use the white color definitely showed signs of wear. The top started to get discolored from the kids holding onto it and in the corner of the top where my daughter climbed in and out of bed the fabric did rip off leaving the metal bar underneath exposed. I guess some level of wear is to be expected but if I could do it again I might get the gray color which would hide some of the dirt that built up on the top of it. (Picture attached).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not for ikea crib, sadly
reviews.reviewText: So we ultimately returned this because it doesn’t work with the IKEA crib. The bottom of the ikea bed/crib is covered in mesh and this needs to go over the rail and connect with a screw. The mesh prevents that. We didn’t realize this until we’d put this together.It was quick and easy to put together. All pieces were there. Size was perfect so she could still have climbed in and out. Stitching appeared to be good quality. I think if you have a wild sleeper, it’ll inevitably break just given the nature of anything taking a beating. But otherwise it looked like it would keep my toddler in and be safe. I can’t speak to anything else since we didn’t get to use it, unfortunately.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy install, came quickly
reviews.reviewText: This product was delivered fast and was easy to assemble. Works great for what it is intended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for transition from crib to bed
reviews.reviewText: (insert backstory that no one wants to read) this product was really easy to assemble and attach to the frame. its secure and sturdy. makes it so the little one can’t fall out of bed - goal accomplished. leaves enough room with how i set it up that she can still get in/out on her own (which was wanted). good product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a perfect rail. We have two and they work great!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is great very easy to assemble
reviews.reviewText: Im very with this so easy to assemble and very sturdy I like is tall enough to protect my kid to not fall

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, no issues at all.
reviews.reviewText: We were very cautious with purchasing due to the mixed reviews. However, I believe they have worked out all the kinks. The bars are slightly flattened so you don't notice them under the mattress. The assembly is very simple. They include straps for the front so when you unlatch it to flip it down it stays strapped down, doesn't lift at all. We actually don't even flip it down because there is room on both sides to get in and out. Been using it for a couple weeks with no issues. Highly recommend if you can't get the original crib railing conversion
Works great. Much better than the munchkin one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Prevents injury when a young child is sleeping!
reviews.reviewText: The instructions were easy to read. My grandson sleeps safe and sound!

I don't normally write reviews but do NOT buy this crib rail. First, you'll need to zip tie part of the rail underneath your mattress springs to ensure that the mattress even lies flat, because installing it as suggested results in the mattress having bumps in it from the metal rods under the mattress. I saw that in other reviews and thought, that's okay, despite it being a design flaw I don't mind the extra effort.Except that, in less than 6 months the fabric on the rail started to fray and come apart, and it's only getting worse by the day. I called the manufacturer, who offers a warranty, but because I bought from this re-seller they won't honour the warranty. And this re-seller doesn't even respond to emails to resolve the issue.Buyer beware.
